title: Have Thine Own Way, Lord

author.name: Adelaide A. Pollard
author.bio: Adelaide A. Pollard was an American hymn writer and speaker best known for her hymn 'Have Thine Own Way, Lord'. Inspired by her personal experiences and deep spiritual commitment, her hymns often reflect themes of surrender and devotion to God. Pollard's contributions to Christian music have left a lasting impact, providing comfort and encouragement to countless believers through her poetic and heartfelt expressions of faith.

lyrics:
1. Have Thine own way, Lord!
Have Thine own way!
Thou art the potter,
I am the clay.
Mold me and make me
after Thy will,
while I am waiting,
yielded and still.

2. Have Thine own way, Lord!
Have Thine own way!
Search me and try me,
Savior today!
Wash me just now, Lord,
wash me just now,
as in Thy presence
humbly I bow.

3. Have Thine own way, Lord!
Have Thine own way!
Wounded and weary,
help me I pray!
Power, all power,
surely is Thine!
Touch me and heal me,
Savior divine!

4. Have Thine own way, Lord!
Have Thine own way!
Hold o'er my being
absolute sway.
Fill with Thy Spirit
till all shall see
Christ only, always,
living in me!
